page.title: 12CONSERVATION
page.content: Within our 'box' there is no conservation (in the by now generally accepted sense) that we know of, with the exception of the Test Way, which runs north/south along the route of the old 'Sprat and Winkle' railway line. This is being developed as a long distance footpath, and the bodies concerned in its upkeep are keen to make its habitats more beneficial to wildlife. Mottisfont, a National Trust property, is within our area, and it might be relevant to record that the collection of traditional varieties of rose is very carefully nurtured. The Test is keepered, as are many of the woods, both for rough and game shooting. Any benefits keepering has for wildlife are coincidental.
